summary: This document is a series of internal emails from July 23, 2019, concerning an incident involving inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It details that Epstein was found with marks on his neck, claimed his cellmate attempted to kill him, and was placed on suicide watch. The emails also discuss plans to move him to general population and confusion over reporting the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at MCC New York who was found with red marks on his neck, claimed his cellmate tried to kill him, and was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Mentioned in an email as someone who needs to be interviewed, likely in relation to the Epstein incident or prison operations.

connections.description: Tartaglione is mentioned as someone to be interviewed in the context of emails discussing Epstein's status and incident, suggesting a potential investigative or administrative link.

events.title: Epstein found with neck injuries in SHU
events.description: At 1:27 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor in a fetal position in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with red marks on his neck. He was placed in restraints, moved to a suicide cell, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Medical and psychological assessment of Epstein
events.description: Epstein was medically assessed at 6:30 a.m. (found with a circular line of erythema on his neck but in no distress) and psychologically evaluated at 9:10 a.m. (determined to remain on suicide watch).

events.title: Review for placement in general population
events.description: Following the incident, prison staff reviewed Epstein's case for placement in the general population in Unit 7 South and were looking for an appropriate cellmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell with red marks on his neck and claimed his cellmate had attempted to kill him.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following the incident, though a medical assessment found him 'ambulatory, oriented x 3' and 'in no apparent distress, smiling'.
Epstein told staff he had informed his attorney about the alleged harassment and attack by his cellmate.
Prison administration was actively reviewing his case to move him to the general population (Unit 7 South) on the same day as the incident.
Internal emails show confusion and a directive to draft a clearer report on Epstein's actions and status for forwarding to higher authorities (IPPA and the Director).
